intro: Crotalaria malindiensis, commonly known as Malindi false Guinea flower, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It produces vibrant yellow flowers that bloom throughout the warmer months. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and potential medicinal research.
